tool.name: Scanpy FilterGenes
tool.description: based on counts and numbers of cells expressed
tool.command: ln -s '${input_obj_file}' input.h5 && scanpy-filter-genes.py -i input.h5 -f '${input_format}' -o output.h5 -F '${output_format}' #if $parameters #set pars = ','.join([str($p['name']) for $p in $parameters]) -p '${pars}' #set mins = ','.join([str($p['min']) for $p in $parameters]) -l '${mins}' #set maxs = ','.join([str($p['max']) for $p in $parameters]) -j '${maxs}' #end if #if $subset -s '${subset}' #end if

param.name: name
param.label: Name of parameter to filter on

param.name: subset
param.label: List of gene IDs or symbols

tool.help:
**What it does**
Filter genes based on number of cells or counts.
Keep genes that have at least ``min_counts`` counts or are expressed in at least ``min_cells`` cells or have at most ``max_counts`` counts or are expressed in at most ``max_cells`` cells.
@HELP@
